subject: Science
title: How Clouds Form
description: A 60-second lesson on How Clouds Form.

hook.text: Clouds look solid, but they're made of trillions of tiny water droplets or ice crystals.

buildup.text: Warm air rises, expands, and cools. Cool air can hold less moisture.

discovery.text: When air cools past its dew point, vapor condenses around tiny particles called nuclei.

twist.text: Without dust, pollen, or pollution, clouds couldn't form at all.

climax.text: A single cumulus cloud can weigh 500,000 kg â€” held aloft by rising air.

punchline.text: Clouds need dirt to exist. No dust, no rain.

quiz.question: What do water droplets need to form clouds?
options: Tiny particles like dust to condense around
